doskill.doclimbing.description:
This skill, when toggled on, enables you to jump upwards when adjacent to walls, effectively letting you easily scale vertical surfaces. When you are in mid air and near a solid block, you'll be able to jump off of it - this can be done repeatedly as long as you're near a scalable surface.
Unfortunately, this skill does not work in the arena. There's no escaping the challenge.
doskill.doclimbing.name: Climbing
doskill.dohealth.description: A straightforward, passive ability, when enabled this skill simply grants extra health to your Deep One form.
doskill.dohealth.name: Extra Health
doskill.dopoison.description:
When toggled on this skill gives you a chance to inject enemies with a powerful poison when you hit them. About one in four hits result in the effect being applied.
It does not, unfortunately, work against bosses.
doskill.dopoison.name: Poison Claws
doskill.doquickstep.description:
When enabled, this skill lets you do quick sidesteps by pressing the Dodge Key ('Alt' by default). Like all skills, it requires you to be in your Deep One form. The direction of the dodge depends on the currently pressed movement keys (WASD).
When used skillfully, the quickstep can speedily bring one out of danger, escaping perilous attacks. It may not, however, be used underwater or in mid air.
doskill.doquickstep.name: Quickstep
doskill.doregeneration.description: When enabled, this skill gives you a regeneration effect every time you slay an enemy. The more powerful the felled creature, the greater the effect. Very weak creatures however might result in no effect being applied.
doskill.doregeneration.name: Corpse Feeding
doskill.doroarsink.description:
When enabled, the Sinking Roar empowers your normal roar by violently sending downwards any waterborne creatures affected by it. Additionally, if the creatures possess a limited air supply (like Players do) the roar will also knock all the air out of their lungs, making them immediately start drowning.
Of course, several enemies are quite resistant to your roars: bosses, Ictya, and other creatures more fearsome than you may be entirely unaffected.
doskill.doroarsink.name: Sinking Roar
doskill.douppercut.description:
Whereas the quickstep puts distance between you and the enemy by moving you away from it, the uppercut achieves the same result by launching your adversary up in the air, with potentially fatal results in the subsequent landing. This skill, when toggled on, lets you right click on other creatures while barehanded to send them flying upwards.
It does, however, become less effective against powerful enemies with large health pools, as well as bosses. It is also of little use in water combat.
doskill.douppercut.name: Uppercut

dweller.lhkeeper.hamletarchitecturetalk0: {Ahh, yes.}:We're very proud of what we've built.|| :And rebuilt. |  :And rebuilt over and over again, just for it to be[ burnt down.
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletarchitecturetalk1: You have no idea of what I'm referring to, right?:In your pursuit of knowledge of the world, you have ignored that of history.
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletartifactstalk0: Those artifacts aren't ours. Well, at least they weren't.:They were brought to us by friends, who took them from foes. |:You don't know what I'm referring to, right?
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletdisliketalk0: That doesn't surprise me,{ outsider}.:What is it you do not like?
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletdisliketalk0.opti: The dwellers.:They seem to despise outsiders.
It's unsettling.:Especially that bizarre sculpture:in the center.
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletdwellerstalk0: Trust me,[ outsider.:They have every right to.] :After what your ancestors did, outsiders are not liked here.|  :But you don't know what I'm talking about, right?
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletidoltalk0: That's the idol of our very own[ God.]| :The deity we chose to believe in, in the shape we saw fit to portray him with.| :I won't criticise you for finding its appearance unsettling.
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletidoltalk1: But if that unsettling feeling were to be replaced with fear and hatred for us and our customs,| then you're no different from your ancestors.
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletidoltalk2: You don't know what I'm referring to, right?
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletliketalk0: {Ohh,} such a pleasure to hear it. Tell me then, traveller,:what is it that{ awes} you in such a{ peculiar} way?
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletliketalk0.option0: The unique architecture,:how everything fits:upon the water on which it's built.
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletliketalk0.option1: The rare items I find here.:The loot.
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletloottalk0: Ah, not just a traveller, but a looter!:What items interest you the most?
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletslugstalk0: HA! |THE SLUGS! |Well, don't eat those! |:[You might regret it.
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletslugstalk1: You can't[ even begin] to imagine how important those slimy creatures are to us.:They are our means of communion, with the God we chose to believe in.
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletslugstalk2: Find that strange? Well, you should.:But if that{ "strangeness"} fills you with fear and hatred for us and our customs,| then you're no different from your ancestors.
dweller.lhkeeper.hamletslugstalk3: You don't know what I'm referring to, right?
dweller.lhkeeper.talk1: I imagine you stumbled upon our Hamlet by chance, in your endless travels.:I can only envy you, stuck as I am,{ watching this lighthouse.
dweller.lhkeeper.talk2: I am left to wonder, though, what does an explorer like you think of our humble Hamlet? |Out of[ all] the beauties you must've admired, what impression does it leave upon you?
dweller.lhkeeper.talk2.option0: It strikes me:with a peculiar sense:of awe.
dweller.lhkeeper.talk2.option1: I do not like it.:There's an atmosphere:of hostility here.
dweller.lhkeepercanoe.talk0: For now, get on a canoe and sail. Talk to a carpenter.
dweller.lhkeeperdreamer.liestalk0: We all are, until we realise how much worse the Truth is. ||:I will help you.
dweller.lhkeeperdreamer.talk0: You are a Dreamer. I know that. |:You seek Truth. I know that too.
dweller.lhkeeperdreamer.talk1: You wish to breach the Veil. To venture Beyond it. |:Well, you already did, if only in Dream, unable to recall anything.
dweller.lhkeeperdreamer.talk2: You now desperately try to convince yourself that you can do it. Succeed where all have failed. Ridding yourself of lies.
dweller.lhkeeperend.talk0: Granting me a few last words? |Thank you, traveller. :I'll make it quick.
dweller.lhkeeperend.talk1: Let's start from an objective Truth. A mathematical one. :The greatest number you could ever think of is nothing to infinity.
dweller.lhkeeperend.talk2: Another Truth. I am insignificant. :There are countless others exactly like me in this very world. Exact copies. :I am just a bunch of ifs and fors, so irrelevant that you would mete out my death with barely any hesitation.
dweller.lhkeeperend.talk3: My question, outsider, is this. :Do you really claim a mind of infinite complexity? I am sorry to say but, that's not the way it is. Billions upon billions of synapses, yet, sooner or later, even your mind could be copied. Just like mine.
dweller.lhkeeperend.talk4: That is a snippet of Truth, outsider, just for you. Your life is worth naught.
dweller.lhkeeperend.talk5: It does not matter what world you come from, the Truth spans all realms. | :Because it lies Beyond The Veil, in the region between all universes.
dweller.lhkeeperend2.talk0: Go ahead, strike me down. My death won't matter. || :And neither will yours.
dweller.lhkeepergratitude.talk0: Should you need to know more, ask.
dweller.lhkeepergreatdreamer.talk0: That statue, in the central square, it represents our marine Deity. |:The Great Dreamer.
dweller.lhkeepergreatdreamer.talk1: You seek the Truth, The Great Dreamer hides it. |:To speak with Him, is to go{ Beyond the Veil.
dweller.lhkeeperhasknowledge.talk0: I.. I do sense within you a{ thirst..}:A certain lust for learning.| A kind of curiousness, a foolish but{ fascinating one.
dweller.lhkeeperiknow.drunktalk0: And you would trust the words of an old, insane drunken fool? |:Why, of course you should. You'll find that insanity brings one closer to Truth, for better or worse.
dweller.lhkeeperiknow.talk0: Ah, I Dreamt of you tonight. You wish to tell me something.
dweller.lhkeeperiknow.victimstalk0: The drunken one appeared in my Dream as well. :It was him who told you something, wasn't he?
dweller.lhkeeperimpressed.talk0: I am impressed traveller. Truly. |:I am impressed by your resolve, your strength of will, your determination in your quest for knowledge, as dangerous as it may be.
dweller.lhkeeperimpressed.talk1: I am impressed by your open mind, realising the misdeeds of your ancestors and disavowing them. |:And most of all, I am impressed at how wholly you pledge yourself to your new belief.
dweller.lhkeeperimpressed.talk2: Be wary of disappointment. Sooner or later, it'll come. It'll sting.
dweller.lhkeeperlackknowledge.talk0: Are you a{ true seeker of knowledge?}:Could you truly be interested in learning more of our past?
dweller.lhkeeperlackknowledge.talk1: I doubt it. Your mind has yet to open.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.fiendtalk0: Why,{ you truly are no different from your ancestors...} are you? |:You just think us monsters, right? Twisted, contorted beings engaging in unholy customs?
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.fiendtalk1: And what is it that drives such thoughts, if you don't mind me asking?:Is it our pale, ghastly skin? Or is it that bizarre sculpture in the central square?
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.fiendtalk1.optio: It is exactly:those things:you're talking about.:You are inhuman.
All of you just:dismissed me with the:very same prejudice you:are now accusing me of.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.inhumantalk0: That |is true.:But what is it that drives humans to[ slaughter] all that resembles them yet isn't truly like them? | :And{ declare themselves SAINTS in the process?
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.inhumantalk1: Ignorance. |Yes, maybe that is it. | :Without knowledge, you make assumptions.[ Dangerous ones.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.inhumantalk2: Why don't you relieve yourself of your prejudice, outsider, and let me tell you how things truly went?
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.prejudicetalk0: ...truth is, outsider..  we are afraid. |:Terribly afraid of ones like you. Ours isn't prejudice as much as it is wariness, justified suspiciousness.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.prejudicetalk1: If you truly want to fight prejudice, then why don't you listen to me, and let me tell how things truly went?
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.talk0: Do you wish to know more of our history? Of all the{ suffering} we've endured?
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.talk1: Do you wish to know more of what your ancestors did to us, in their fear of the[ unknown?
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.talk1.option0: Tell me more.:I wish to know.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.tellmetalk0: It is refreshing to see one of you seek this knowledge instead of fleeing it. |:Although, of course.. |I must warn you. |{:Knowledge is fear.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture.tellmetalk1: The more you know, |the more you see, |the{ blinder you are,} |once you realise what Veil of illusions is clouding your mind. |:An{ unbreachable] Veil. | Trust me,{ I tried}. To no avail.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.friendslecturet: That is none of your concern, for as long as you remain an outsider.:But that doesn't have to stay like that.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.lecturetalk0: There are many Hamlets like ours in this world, although not as many as there once were. But they've all got something in common.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.lecturetalk1: You may have been turned off initially by the blackness and dampness of the surrounding territory, but everytime you see it, it means that at one point in time a Hamlet like ours stood there.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.lecturetalk2: The ground wasn't always like this, though. :Contrary to what some may think, we didn't settle here because of any appeal the soil had upon us. :In fact, we are the very reason the ground became so.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.lecturetalk3: It was our worship of our Deity that made it happen, and if that doesn't prove its realness, then I don't know what will.:Unfortunately, many of[ your ancestors] did not like the idea of a god truer than theirs.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.lecturetalk4: In fact they were so disgusted at the idea of a deity turning the ground black and damp that they deemed us 'heretics', and started hunting us down.[ One by one.]
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.lecturetalk5: {Our homes were burned, our people slaughtered.} Our fathers, the survivors, lost everything. It was a{ massacre.}{ It was a[ GENOCIDE].
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.lecturetalk6: And they deemed themselves "Saints" and "Hunters", those{ merciless murderers.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.lecturetalk7: But we had friends. Powerful friends, who pulled the war away from us, and upon themselves. Oh, and if it wasn't for them, our whole people would've been{ eradicated.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.lecturetalk8: Nobody won in those times. And all of it for{ your ancestors'} disdain for that which is different. For the dark sand below us, and the weird shape of our Deity.
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.lecturetalk9: Do you understand now why my fellow dwellers, as well as I, have such disdain for outsiders? Why we are so wary of them?
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.talk0: So, traveller, what'll it be? Will you listen now to our story?
dweller.lhkeeperlecture2.thankstalk0: And you have my gratitude. For listening to my tale, our history.:For relieving me of the burden of knowledge.
dweller.lhkeepernewyou.talk1: The slugs. Eat them. Even if they hurt.
dweller.lhkeeperocean.talk0: Traveller, all Dreams go through water. Through The Great Dreamer. |:Look at the Ocean.
dweller.lhkeeperoldtruth.genocideagreeta: That is what we think as well. :Yet your forefathers knew better, it seems.
dweller.lhkeeperoldtruth.genocidedisagre: There is no right answer. :But know that I{ despise} those who think the way you do.
dweller.lhkeeperoldtruth.talk0: From his words, an old Truth arises. :MY ancestors' traditions went too far at times. Sacrifices, murders, experiments.
dweller.lhkeeperoldtruth.talk1: Blood lays in the black sand beneath us. They did it for power, through unholy pacts. The Great Dreamer, or rather, his ArchPriest, demanded payment.
dweller.lhkeeperoldtruth.talk2: You didn't need this Truth. It would've only dissuaded you from your goal. :You see? I had to hide it.  My own Veil, of sorts.
dweller.lhkeeperoldtruth.talk3: That, however, does not excuse in the slightest that which happened to us. :No sin is great enough to justify GENOCIDE.
dweller.lhkeeperpast.talk0: It matters not. Let the past stay past, we are not the ones who may walk through time. Only speak.
dweller.lhkeeperritual.talk0: We Dwellers can't breathe water from the moment we're born. No, it comes later.
dweller.lhkeeperritual.talk1: It is only through endless devotion to The Great Dreamer that an outsider such as you may be granted this Gift. :To us it's different. Genetic. I won't mention the details.
dweller.lhkeeperritual.talk2: But ultimately, for both of our kinds it is only through an act of faith that we may be granted the Gift. |:You must drown.
dweller.lhkeeperritual.talk3: There is a ritual that must be made. I could explain it to you, yet I am certain that that voice in your head will take care of it.
dweller.lhkeeperritual.talk4: I still remember when I underwent the ritual. You will too.
dweller.lhkeeperritual.talk5: I was under the water, I couldn't breathe, I was going to die, I knew I was and I regretted it, I regretted everything and I couldn't breathe and they had lied to me and they had left me to drown and I had to believe but I couldn't and I was dying and I BREATHE. :In. And out. In. And out. Again. And again.
dweller.lhkeeperritual.talk6: That was my Baptism. Soon, you shall have yours.
dweller.lhkeeperritualintro.talk0: But now, it's time you take the next step.
dweller.scholar.talk0: Oh my! A traveller! |:Hello! Hi! Greetings! Welcome! Salutations!
dweller.scholar.talk1: I am this Hamlet's Scholar! A rare profession nowadays. :Haha. Most of us are dead.
dweller.scholar.talk2: No worries though. Thou art a friend, ain't ya? |:Feel free to browse the Town Hall.
dweller.scholarbreath.talk0: Remember when ya were baptised and then breathed HARD in a voice that wasn't thine? :Heh.
dweller.scholarshoggoth.enlightentalk0: Oh no I'm not doin' that. :Thou art lucky enough as it is, my dude.
dweller.scholarshoggoth.enlightentalk1: Yet I fear that that voice in thy head will, sooner or later, tell thee how to make one.
dweller.scholarshoggoth.sorrytalk0: Oh. |I'm sorry, really. |:That is not a knowledge borne lightly.
dweller.scholarshoggoth.sorrytalk1: I beg of thee, friend. :Don't trust the Shoggoth. Thou will regret it.
dweller.scholarshoggoth.sorrytalk2: It was that voice in thy head that told ya how to make one, eh?

ictya.adeline.description:
The Adeline is a translucent medium sized Ictya, of little threat to us unless very hungry. Due to its transparency it can be hard for us to identify it, and it proves even harder for small Ictya, which won't flee even when it closes in on them.
The Adeline got its name from its discoverer: Saint Adeline, wife of the legendary hero Saint Jerome with whom she ventured into Arche to hunt the Deep Ones.
Rumour has it that it was actually Jerome who found it first, but that in his pride he didn't want his name attached to an oversized sea slug.
ictya.bonecage.description:
The Bonecage is an unsettling eel-like large Ictya. Due to its size, it might attack us when hungry.
It's fast, strong and incredibly resilient. It attacks by opening up the boney spikes on its head, then violently closing them on the target as if to encase it in a veritable bone cage. Huge range and the tendency to pull targets in after hitting them means one would do best to avoid its attacks, and try circling it as much as possible to attack it from behind.
ictya.cephalopodian.description:
A large sized squid-like Ictya, the Cephalopodian is a fearsome creature which may be a threat to us when hungry.
It attacks by closing its "mouth-head" on the unfortunate prey. If taken from behind it can also flail its tentacles dealing high knockback, but virtually no damage.
Due to the high damage dealt by its mouth it is preferable to circle it and attack it from behind on its tentacles, though their flailing may prove itself a hindrance.
It is rumoured that within the flaps of its mouth there is a pair of red and blue eyes, though no one has concrete proof of it as of yet.
ictya.deep_angler.description:
Small predators found everywhere throughout Arche, Deep Anglers pose little threat to us, generally only preying on tiny Ictya.
They follow an intriguing hunting pattern: when they're hungry and no prey is beside them, they will lure one from afar, then close in quickly once it gets near enough. One wonders whether we could learn from this.
ictya.dreadfish.description:
Dreadfishes are medium sized Ictya. This means that, while generally hunting for smaller prey, they may assail us as well if very hungry.
They are fast and strong, and compared to most other Ictya they have a much closer bond between each other. Attacking one Dreadfish makes all its close by kin retaliate against the offender. This may be used to our advantage: if we get a large sized Ictya to accidentally attack a single Dreadfish, then those nearby will also join the fight.
Just like crows, a large number of Dreadfishes is called a "murder", but for very different reasons.
ictya.man_o_war.description:
Contrary to popular belief, the Man O' War is not a jellyfish. It is, instead, a colony of small organisms that live together in harmony. This is most apparent when observing the Ictya's attack pattern: rather than chasing the enemy itself, it generates small creatures, each known as a "Jelly", which close in on the enemy to damage it, feeding the Man O' War when the target is slain.
They are medium sized, and thus won't attack us unless very hungry.
ictya.muray.description:
Murays are found in the caves of Arche. They're small predators, and generally only attack the smallest of Ictya, though if hungry they may prey on creatures of their size.
They don't pose a threat to us, though they will retaliate if attacked.
Quite beautiful to look at when they slither through the waters of Arche. A bit less so when their three-sided jaws are open wide.
ictya.octid.description:
Easily the most annoying Ictya I've ever encountered, these little jerks are at the bottom of the food chain and never fight back against larger predators. However, as you may have already learned, they tend to flee when a possible predator gets too close, while also spraying pink ink right in their face. Unfortunately they do not distinguish between predator and regular passerby, and might blind you at most inopportune times. Perhaps in the Deep Cities we can find a solution.
At least, the Octids make for a fine food source - stay some distance away from them, then close in quickly to attack before they have a chance to blind you.
ictya.sandflatter.description:
One of the most insidious creatures of Arche, the Sandflatter is a lobster-like large Ictya found in the more level regions of Arche. Unlike most other Ictya, it has a clear preference towards you Players, and will always be a threat when one gets unfortunately close.
The small tentacle atop its back is merely a bait for unlucky fools, and if you don't escape the subsequent attack quickly you might not live to regret it.
Once it has dislodged itself from its ambush position, it will chase the victim - if still alive - and rapidly whip down its health with its claws. Its sturdy exoskeleton provides resistance to damage to the Sandflatter unless it is attacked from below, on its softer belly - which is where you should always attack it.
Yes, I should have told you that before you killed one. Apologies.
ictya.sarfin.description:
The most populous inhabitants of Arche, sarfins are at the very bottom of the food chain, and serve as the primary food source for most larger Ictya, as well as you.
They will never fight back, but are prone to fleeing when a larger creature gets too close. Due to their small size, hunting them can get both hard and frustrating. Try staying some small distance away from them, then quickly close in to attack before they have a chance to escape.
ictya.umancala.description:
The Umancala's name derives from the words "Umano" and "Calamaro", respectively "Human" and "Squid". The squid part being obvious, the human attribute was given to it by its ancient discoverers when they mistook its flailing tentacles for a human swimmer's legs, used for propulsion in water.
That's where the similarities end, however. The Umancala is a bizarre looking medium sized Ictya, generally preying on smaller Ictya and seldom attacking us, unless very hungry. They hunt by generating extremely hot balls of boiling water which are then fired towards targets, akin to a Blaze's fireballs in the Nether.

mirror.abouttoenter.forgot.0: [Y]Grab the token and enter the Blood Well.
mirror.archepreparation.arena.0: [Y]There should be an appropriate mechanism in the large arena, I believe. We'll see when we're there.
mirror.archepreparation.here.0: [Y]Bring a few torches, Al Azif, this Mirror, and preferably little else. Maybe some normal food, in case you find air pockets to transform into a human again.
mirror.archepreparation.ictya.0: [Y]Unlikely. In the Deep One form you'd count as a medium sized Ictya, so only ones that are larger and somewhat hungry will attack you.
mirror.archepreparation.ictya.1: [Y]When available, they'll generally go for smaller prey. Of course, most will retaliate when attacked.
mirror.archepreparation.ready.0: [Y]Then grab the token and enter the Blood Well.
mirror.archepreparation.second.arena: The duels with the Deep Ones, how do I start them?
mirror.archepreparation.second.ictya: Will the Ictyas attack me on sight?
mirror.archepreparation.second.veil: How do we reach the Veil from Arche?
mirror.archepreparation.veil.0: [Y]That, I do not know yet. I never got that far myself.
mirror.archepreparation.veil.1: [Y]Perhaps it will reveal itself when we're ready for it.
mirror.archepreparation.veil.2: [Y]Or perhaps when it is ready for us.
mirror.archepreparation.veil.3: [Y]For now, focus on getting familiar with Arche. Its food chain, its inhabitants, its challenges.
mirror.archewater.academic.0: [Y]It is only academics of the occult who studied it, I am afraid.
mirror.archewater.academic.1: [Y]In your civilization, a principle of things different from the one posited by religious leaders was considered heretic, as a late friend of yours may have already mentioned.
mirror.archewater.alien.knowalien: How do you know all this?
mirror.archewater.alien.more: There are other things I wish to speak about.
mirror.archewater.alien.oceans: Do other worlds have oceans of their own?
mirror.archewater.apeiron.0: [Y]Yes.. and no. You see, the only answer to this was that the true principle of all things lied not in your universe, but outside of it.
mirror.archewater.apeiron.1: [Y]It would also have explained how the cosmos and the stars and the nebulae came to be, so far from our own oceans. Multiple breaches between our universe and what was "outside".
mirror.archewater.apeiron.2: [Y]Academia called it "Apeiron". It means "Infinity", and it is that which lies, as it is now believed, Beyond the Veil.
mirror.archewater.apeiron.3: [Y]It is filtered by the Veil, the Great Dreamer himself, and touches our world through the Void, bringing into existence Arche and all the other deepest oceans in the Cosmos.
mirror.archewater.apeiron.4: [Y]Then, when fire wanted to burn on our planet, the Void created a middle plane between Arche and the Overworld, and through what we now call the Nether even fire is born from water, channeled by quartz.
mirror.archewater.apeiron.5: [Y]Likewise flared the stars - to which Dagon is elder, for he was born with Arche, oldest among the living.
mirror.archewater.apeiron.6: [Y]So everything comes from the waters of Arche, yet even those waters come from Apeiron.
mirror.archewater.cities.0: [Y]Their buildings are indeed quite striking - so much so that even your ancestors were initially shocked when they first set gaze upon them.
mirror.archewater.cities.1: [Y]The Deep Ones they'd once believed to be mindless creatures had in truth known enlightenment far before they did.
mirror.archewater.fire.0: [Y]Brilliant answer! That is precisely what the philosophers of yore realised.
mirror.archewater.fire.1: [Y]So, if fire wasn't born from water - or at least not directly - then there must have been something else, before water, right?
mirror.archewater.first.home: What was that red, blood structure I entered Arche through?
mirror.archewater.first.whatis: Now that I've been to Arche, could you explain to me what it actually is?
mirror.archewater.flaw.academic: Aeons of academic study, yet no one has ever heard of it?
mirror.archewater.flaw.fire: Water may not give birth to fire, its opposite.
mirror.archewater.flaw.nether: Below the world lies the Nether, then only void above and beneath it.
mirror.archewater.flaw.principle: Water may not give birth to itself, even Arche needs a principle.
mirror.archewater.food.0: [Y]Progress through Arche should be slow and calculated. Do not hesitate to stop to hunt every so often.
mirror.archewater.food.1: [Y]A larger Ictya results in a more sizeable repast - at the cost of augmented risk.
mirror.archewater.foodchain.0: [Y]Given the chaotic nature of Arche, it is truly quite marvelous that a hierarchy of order - that is, the food chain - has established itself here.
mirror.archewater.foodchain.1: [Y]Of course, our goal is to break that order. To ascend the chain, until we sit at its very top.
mirror.archewater.hates.food: The constant search for food, the growing hunger assailing my miserable belly.
mirror.archewater.hates.ictya: The fauna. I feel vulnerable among these new threats, in their bizarre, almost alien shapes and sizes.
mirror.archewater.hates.immense2: It is immense - I feel tiny. No, less than that.
mirror.archewater.hates.notreally: Actually, I don't really hate it.
mirror.archewater.here.0: [Y]Some did, yes. Chief among them Saint Jerome, though I do not know what fate he met.
mirror.archewater.here.1: [Y]Probably not different from his companions. Crushed beneath the pressure of Arche, the few survivors immediately murdered by Ictya and Deep Ones.
mirror.archewater.home.1: [Y]There are several such structures in Arche - different visitors to Arche will generally enter different Blood Homes.
mirror.archewater.home.2: [Y]Every time you enter this underworld you'll be transported to this structure. Feel free to make it your base.
mirror.archewater.ictya.0: [Y]The chaotic, ever churning waters of Arche may well give life to all sorts of bizarre creatures.
mirror.archewater.ictya.1: [Y]And alien, yes. Perhaps more than one'd think. Other worlds harbour quite similar beings in their own deepest oceans.
mirror.archewater.immense.0: [Y]Indeed. So close to the Veil and the Truth lying Beyond it, Arche is truly magnificent.
mirror.archewater.immense.1: [Y]An unparalleled feeling of wonder, though perhaps a bitter one, reminding us of how tiny we are.
mirror.archewater.immense2.0: [Y]Indeed. So close to the Veil and the Truth lying Beyond it, Arche is a reminder of our inconsequentiality.
mirror.archewater.immense2.1: [Y]And yet, I find there to be beauty in it too - a sense of wonder, its massive scale dwarfing and outlasting anything we could construct.
mirror.archewater.knowalien.0: [Y]Once again, I must bar you from learning more of my nature. It is for your own good.
mirror.archewater.knowalien.1: [Y]Suffice to say - I've met many beings from different worlds. *Many*.
mirror.archewater.life.0: [Y]You did not truly believe to be alone in the universe, did you?
mirror.archewater.life.1: [Y]Yes, civilizations exist on another worlds, spread out among the stars. Some have even visited this world.
mirror.archewater.love.0: [Y]And what do you love most about it?
mirror.archewater.loves.cities: The cities and architecture of the Deep Ones - a hidden civilization at the very bottom of the world.
mirror.archewater.loves.foodchain: The food chain itself. A tangible lesson of the crude truth that is survival of the fittest.
mirror.archewater.loves.ictya: The fauna. Shapes and sizes undreamt of before. Alien, almost.
mirror.archewater.loves.immense: It is immense - new emotions spring forth, of freedom and wonder.
mirror.archewater.loves.notreally: Actually, I don't really love it.
mirror.archewater.nether.0: [Y]Ahh, but Arche lies even below the Nether. Although, the answer does in fact relate to that hellish place.
mirror.archewater.none.0: [Y]Nor did the philosophers, at first. But you have seen more Truth than they did, and can attempt a better guess, can't you?
mirror.archewater.oceans.0: [Y]Indeed. Arche exists beneath many worlds, and even in the emptiest regions of the universe you can find its waters swirling unendingly.
mirror.archewater.octid.0: [Y]Ohh, do I understand. We'll seek a solution together.
mirror.archewater.octid.1: [Y]Perhaps the Deep Ones have found a defense against it. We could search one in their cities.
mirror.archewater.principle.0: [Y]Great answer! Not the one I was thinking of, mind you, but you reached the same conclusion as the philosophers of yore.
mirror.archewater.principle.1: [Y]What they had noticed was that fire may not have been born from water, for they are opposites on the elemental spectrum.
mirror.archewater.principle.2: [Y]So, if fire wasn't born from water - or at least not directly - then, just like you said, there must have been something else before water, right?
mirror.archewater.results.0: [Y]Not much. Many of them had a penchant for brains, though, and some villagers are occasionally abducted.
mirror.archewater.results.1: [Y]Don't be scared. After all, it is no more terrifying than our own organ harvesting.
mirror.archewater.whatis.0: [Y]Arche is the deepest of all oceans, yet, even more than that, it is a *concept*.
mirror.archewater.whatis.1: [Y]Arche is the principle of all that belongs to our world. It is that from which all is born, living and not.
mirror.archewater.whatis.2: [Y]Flesh and stone, lightning and bone, the Cosmos and the sea, the Dwellers and thee. All from its waters.
mirror.archewater.whatis.3: [Y]Arche has been the subject of study of the occult academia for aeons, now. First, by philosophers; then, by warlocks; now, even by scientists.
mirror.archewater.whatis.4: [Y]However, there is a flaw in all of this. Can you spot it?
mirror.archewater.which.0: [Y]Their names would be meaningless to you now. Some had the appearance of fungi, others of ticks, others yet had.. well.. they become hard to describe.
mirror.archewater.which.1: [Y]Many of them had a penchant for brains, though.
mirror.arena.first.how: How do I begin the battle?
mirror.arena.first_branch.0: [Y]I believe we just found the arena.
mirror.arena.first_branch.1: [Y]This is where you can prove your mettle.
mirror.arena.how.0: [Y]Try interacting with that red block in the corner.
mirror.arena.how.1: [Y]Note that the adversaries you'll meet are powerful, and won't go down easily.
mirror.arena.how.2: [Y]However, you shouldn't fear death. I think you'll be sent back here in case of defeat, without losing any items.
mirror.beforearche.everbeen.0: [Y]Yes, long ago. Though it has changed little since then.
mirror.beforearche.first.everbeen: Have you ever been to Arche yourself?
mirror.beforearche.recording.0: [Y]More like a livestream, though still not quite.
mirror.beforearche.recording.1: [Y]It's not something I am willing to explain just yet. Some truths must be spoonfed.
mirror.beforearche.trust.0: [Y]Yes. Which is why I will tell you. When the time is ripe.
mirror.bloodhome.what.1: [Y]There are several such structures in Arche - different visitors to Arche will generally enter different Blood Homes.
mirror.bloodhome.what.2: [Y]Every time you enter this underworld you'll be transported to this structure. Feel free to make it your base.
mirror.start.anyone_there2.0: [Y]There is still no answer. You should stop enquiring.
mirror.start.final.whoareyou2: I still wish to know who you are.
mirror.start.gavewhat.name: What is your name?
mirror.start.getout.0: [Y]You do not understand what you're asking for.
mirror.start.guide.guiding: How will you take me there?
mirror.start.guiding.0: [Y]I've been your guiding hand, the one that helped you write.
mirror.start.guiding.1: [Y]Our researches are born out of both of our minds. I'll help you through Al Azif.
mirror.start.howdreamer.1: [Y]Beneath Arche there is the Void. And then, the Veil.
mirror.start.insignificant.0: [Y]Several times you have reached this conclusion, but it hasn't yet stuck, has it?
mirror.start.insignificant.1: [Y]You're taking it harder, or maybe easier, than I did, when I was your age.
mirror.start.more.0: [Y]It is no easy task, but I shall.
mirror.start.more.1: [Y]It is necessary, for us to go forward.
mirror.start.nearlythere.howdreamer: How will we reach The Dreamer?
mirror.start.novessel.0: [Y]Our bond goes too deep for either of us to sunder it.
mirror.start.novessel.1: [Y]It is far more ancient than either of us.
mirror.start.novessel.2: [Y]Too much to explain right now. Soon, I'll give you answers. Truth.
mirror.start.old.0: [Y]In time, you'll look back at this question, and laugh at it.
mirror.start.parasite.1: [Y]I granted you knowledge, you granted me a vessel.
mirror.start.reached2.insignificant: Then.. then I truly am insignificant.. irrelevant..
mirror.start.reached2.wat: What? I spoke wih Him! I heard Him and He heard me!
mirror.start.thankful.0: [Y]Yes, through me it was that you communed.
mirror.start.understand.name: What is your name?
mirror.start.veil.0: [Y]The filter through which what you know as 'reality' is born.
mirror.start.veil.1: [Y]The curtain that hides all that is True.
mirror.start.veil.2: [Y]The gateway that only Dreams may go through.
mirror.start.vessel.thankful: If it was through you that I reached The Great Dreamer, then I am thankful.
mirror.start.wat.0: [Y]Only through Dagon were your thoughts connected. A Veil before the Veil.
mirror.start.whoareyou2.0: [Y]A friend. One who had to conceal his own identity for your sake.
mirror.start.whoshiding.getout: Get out. Get out get out get out GET OUT OF ME.
mirror.start.whoshiding.whoareyou: Who are you? What are you doing.. in my mind?
mirror.start.whosyou.1: Someone's hiding.. here.. inside of me?
mirror.start.youknow.1: [Y]But we can learn more of it, together, if you follow me.
